heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 28 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 13.3°C), outside temperature (down 11.7°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 9118 lux) and cloud levels (up 412 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 54.9°C), light levels (up 9638 lux), and cloud levels (up 462 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 412.1m lower than yesterday, 461.8m lower than the past week, 329.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 821m minimum and 3400m maximum, with an average of 1382.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1844.6m and 1712.3m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; freezing temperatures are anticipated. Also, the air will feel dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (4.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
